container-title: An early work, Causation in the Law
note: arguments against ‘morals’ legislation (Law, Liberty, and Morality, 1963), and several studies in the theory of punishment published as Punishment and Responsibility (1968). Hart resigned his chair in
title: Herbert Hart was educated at New College, Oxford, and practised law for eight years before working in military intelligence during the Second World War. Returning to Oxford, first as a tutor in philosophy and then as professor of jurisprudence, Hart introduced the analytical techniques pioneered by J
Austin and Gilbert Ryle into the study of legal theory
was followed by his major work in jurisprudence, The Concept of Law
and was elected principal of Brasenose College
